body.p: The undersigned citizens of Franklin & Scott counties Ky understanding that Ch H Tomlin who is in the Penitentiary of this state for killing Thos Estis has a petition now before the Govenor of Kentucky to pardon said Tomlin. Respectfully remonstate against the pardon
1 Because the petition if we are rightly informed represents Estes to have been a bad man & Tomlin an inoffensive one when the reverse is the truth
2 Because the petition is not signed by persons who knew the parties intimately but by those whose sympathies have been appealed to who live some distance from where Tomlin & Estis lived

3 Because the punishment inflicted on Tomlin if fully borne out to the end of the sentence was & is a light punishment for killing Estis when there was no occasion for shooting him -- When Tomlin was in no danger of being seriously injured himself & he had the benefit of having his own brothers testimony. The only witness present at this killing & who may well be presumed to have given the facts as favorable to his brother Charles as they could be given
4 The remission of such light punishment for an unnecessary & wanton killing of a peaceable citizen would not do any good but great harm
